frontmatter.title: Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing (OFDM), Subcarriers, Resource Blocks and more in 4G and 5G
frontmatter.description: OFDM allows multiple subcarriers within resource blocks to overlap significantly while producing little to no interference, allowing 5G to use its frequency allocation far more effectively.

frontmatter.title: Phone mast sectorisation and mast deployment patterns
frontmatter.description: To provide mobile coverage to a large area, masts need to be deployed in sectors. This article provides an overview of the sectorisation process and the deployment patterns.

frontmatter.title: How do LTE frequency bands and duplex modes affect throughput?
frontmatter.description: LTE functions on a wide range of frequencies. These frequency ranges are called bands, and are standardised across the world.

frontmatter.title: What are 4G and LTE?
frontmatter.description: 4G and LTE are often regarded as the same, but there are some differences between them.
